title: 107_s2187
content: The Act titled "Department of Veterans Affairs Emergency Medical Care Act of 2002" authorizes the Department to provide health care during major disasters and medical emergencies. The Department of Veterans Affairs can provide hospital care and medical services during major disasters and emergencies declared by the President or when the National Disaster Medical System is activated. The Department of Veterans Affairs can provide care and services during disasters or emergencies declared by the President or when the National Disaster Medical System is activated. The Secretary may prioritize care for veterans regardless of their enrollment status, except for those with service-connected disabilities or active duty members of the Armed Forces. The Department of Veterans Affairs can provide care and services during disasters or emergencies. Care is prioritized for veterans, excluding those with service-connected disabilities or active duty members of the Armed Forces. Reimbursement for care provided to non-Department employees is based on agreed rates. Amounts received are credited to the facility that provided the care. The Federal Government, excluding the Department, will be reimbursed for care or services provided at agreed rates. Amounts received will be credited to the Department facility that provided the care. The Secretary must report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs within 60 days of a disaster or emergency on the allocation of facilities and personnel for care and services. Regulations will be prescribed for the Secretary's authority under this section. The Secretary must report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs about the allocation of facilities and personnel for care and services. Regulations will be prescribed for the Secretary's authority under this section. During major disasters and medical emergencies, charges for emergency care may be waived. The Secretary can provide hospital care, nursing home care, and medical services to members of the Armed Forces during periods of war or national emergencies involving armed conflict. Additionally, care can be provided during disasters or emergencies as specified. During a national emergency involving armed conflict, the Secretary can provide hospital care, nursing home care, and medical services to active duty members of the Armed Forces. In the event of a disaster or emergency declared by the President or involving the National Disaster Medical System, care can also be provided to those responding to or involved in the situation. The Secretary can prioritize providing care and services during a disaster or emergency declared by the President or involving the National Disaster Medical System. This includes hospital care, nursing home care, and medical services to eligible individuals, with exceptions for veterans with service-connected disabilities.
